intro: Ononis alopecuroides var. baetica, commonly known as the Iberian sand-verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a low-growing perennial herb with small, often pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has hairy, linear leaves and thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often in coastal or inland dry habitats. It is well adapted to arid conditions and is characteristic of Mediterranean vegetation. This variety is distinguished by its specific geographic distribution and morphological traits compared to other variants of the species.
